Class WriteFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • print.WriteFile

  • public class WriteFile
extends java.lang.Object
    WriteFile.java Simple class used to write to a file one line at a time. 
        Platform: jdk 1.7.0_4; NetBeans IDE 7.0; Windows 7
    Course: CS 142
    Hours: 1 hour
    Created on Apr 24, 2013, 10:00 PM
    Revised on

      Constructor and Description
      WriteFile(java.lang.String inputFilename)
      A constructor that accepts a String parameter for the specified file path to write to.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Simple method that closes the file that was being written to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WriteFile

        public WriteFile(java.lang.String inputFilename)
          throws java.io.IOException
        A constructor that accepts a String parameter for the specified file path to write to.
        Parameters:
        inputFilename - The string representation of the file path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file is unable to be located or created an IOException is thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String item)
        This method writes to the specified file one line at a time.
        Parameters:
        item - A line of text to be written to the specified file.

      • close

        public void close()
        Simple method that closes the file that was being written to. If the file isn't closed than changes are liable to be unsaved.
